DOCNAME: CASE OF ZIMONIN AND OTHERS v. RUSSIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property (Article 1 para. 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Deprivation of property)
JUDGES: Branko Lubarda;Georgios A. Serghides;Pere Pastor Vilanova
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants are NORP nationals . They were owners of flats in GPE . The ORG authorities reclaimed the flats , and the ORG title to the real property in question was annulled .
CARDINAL . NORP The flat at CARDINAL - CARDINAL GPE , GPE , was owned by PERSON On DATE PERSON died intestate with no surviving kin .
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON bought the flat from a person acting on PERSON ’s behalf by virtue of a power of attorney .
CARDINAL . On DATE M. sold the flat to O.
CARDINAL . On DATE O. sold the flat to ORG
CARDINAL . On DATE V. sold the flat to the applicant and his minor daughter .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the police opened an investigation into the fraudulent sale of the flat after PERSON ’s death . On DATE the police informed ORG ( ORG ) about the investigation .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date ORG brought an action against the applicant seeking the transfer of the title to the flat to GPE and the applicant ’s eviction .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Kuntsevskiy ORG of GPE granted ORG claims in full . The court established that PERSON had died intestate with no surviving kin and that the flat should have been considered bona vacantia . It considered all the transactions with the flat to be void and ordered the transfer of the title to the flat to GPE and the applicant ’s eviction .

CARDINAL . The flat at CARDINAL , PERSON , GPE , was owned by NORP DATE S. died intestate with no surviving kin .
CARDINAL . On DATE an unidentified person sold the flat to B.
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON sold the flat to PERSON , the applicant ’s father .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Nagatinskiy ORG of GPE approved a friendly settlement agreement between the applicant and her father recognising the applicant ’s title to the flat .
CARDINAL . On DATE the police opened an investigation into the fraudulent sale of the flat after S. ’s death . On CARDINAL DATE the police informed ORG about the investigation .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date ORG brought a civil action against the applicant seeking the transfer of the title to the flat to GPE and the applicant ’s eviction .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG granted ORG claims in full . The court established that PERSON had died intestate with no surviving kin and that the flat should have been considered bona vacantia . The court ruled that the case fell under one of the CARDINAL exceptions to the protection of a bona fide purchaser ’s title , which required that precedence be given to the previous owner who had been deprived of the property against his or her will . The applicant ’s title to the flat was annulled and the title was transferred to GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of DATE on appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused to allow the applicant ’s cassation appeal .
CARDINAL . According to the applicant , the judgment in the GPE ’s favour has not been enforced and the applicant continues to reside in the flat .
CARDINAL . The flat at DATE , ORG , GPE , had been owned by ORG , who died intestate with no surviving kin on DATE .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date PERSON and other unidentified persons forged ORG will , naming P. as ORG ’s heir .
CARDINAL . On DATE applied to a notary seeking to be recognised as ORG ’s heir . On DATE the notary issued a certificate confirming that P. had inherited ORG ’s flat .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( the “ Registration Board ” ) registered the certificate confirming P. ’s title to the flat and issued the relevant deed .
CARDINAL . On DATE P. sold the flat to the first applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG registered the flat purchase and issued the respective deed to the first applicant . The applicants moved into the flat and resided there .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the authorities opened a criminal investigation concerning the forgery of the will issued on behalf of ORG

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE found P. guilty of several counts of fraud and sentenced him to DATE imprisonment . In particular , the court established that P. , acting in concert with other persons whose identity was not known , had fraudulently acquired ORG ’s flat and sold it to the first applicant on the basis of a forged will . The court also found that the flat was bona vacantia which therefore vested in the ORG and , by having fraudulently acquired title to it and then sold it to the first applicant , PERSON had caused damage to the ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of CARDINAL DATE on appeal .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG brought a civil action against the applicants seeking , inter alia , ( CARDINAL ) revocation of the first applicant ’s title to the flat ; ( CARDINAL ) the applicants’ eviction ; and ( CARDINAL ) restitution of the flat to GPE .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG of GPE granted ORG claims . It established that the flat was bona vacantia and ordered its restitution to GPE . It also revoked the first applicant ’s title to the flat and ordered the applicants’ eviction .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of CARDINAL DATE on appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused to allow the applicants’ cassation appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE refused to allow the ORG cassation appeal .
CARDINAL . It appears that the judgment in the GPE ’s favour has not been enforced to date . The applicants continue to reside in the flat .
